comment: I'm begging you please don't take if you have an option for another professor. To all mechatronics people you understand. Also his rating are inflated cause he rates himself just goes to show his character.

He doesn't teach. He just rambles about useless stuff that doesn't have anything to do with the class. If he didn't have extra credit assignments worth 20% of each test grade, barely anyone would pass his class. The worst part is he's the only one that teaches this class, so just try to keep your head down and not to get on his bad side.

Guerra is not a professor; he does not teach the material in a meaningful way nor give actual feedback. He does not explain questions asked in class, and assignments are extremely disorganized and unfocused. The units feel unrelated and extremely difficult without proper explanation. I highly suggest AVOIDING this professor. 

P.S. he likes glass

comment: Almost all of the positive reviews here were written by Guerra himself. Just goes to show he isn't good enough to earn them legit

He takes advantage of his students to perform works that he takes credit for his self-interest and gain. He puts his name first on papers he didn't write, but his students took the time to. He takes control over groups and project assignments to control the outcome. He leaves no room for student interest. He only wants publications and citations.

comment: If you want a professor that will help you go beyond your expected limitations in the most rewarding way, I highly recommend Dr. Guerra. If you truly want to learn and be successful in the future, Dr. Guerra's very passion is helping his students achieve great things. I would knock on his door for research opportunities. Do the work, and make an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I really enjoyed having Dr. Guerra as a professor. His labs open the door for a lot of opportunities that prepare you for an engineering career in automation, so take advantage of them, and expand on them outside of class. He is a very experienced industry expert that will help if asked.

I took Dr. Guerra for MTRE 3800 and 4100 and worked with him in Senior Design (MTRE 4800). Dr. Guerra is an amazing professor and mentor and will do his best to help you understand the topics if you take your time to ask. There is a lot of homework and writing for lab reports but everything you do helps you really learn and succeed in this field.

Took him for MTRE 3800/4100 and worked with him during my MTRE 4800 project. There are times where the HW's and labs can be a bit overwhelming, but all the assignments are useful in aiding your knowledge. He is very enthusiastic in his teaching and actively works to improve your interest and success in his courses. Take if you can!

Professor Guerra is a fantastic professor. Really cares about his students and has a lot of information to give to you. He has a lot of work for you todo, but it is super worthwhile. None of his assignments or labs were a waste of time. Just be prepared to be writing a lot of lab reports and doing a lot of homework. Don't worry too much about tests

Dr. Guerra is an awesome teacher and I really enjoyed taking him for both Instruments and Controls and Fluid Power. The classes themselves are fairly difficult but they aren't impossible. The biggest thing to do for each test is to study the homework and lecture slides as you would in most classes. He grades with partial credit on everything.

Very strict on attendance and participation. Will call you out and mark your absence/silence in front of the class. He's a cool/smart guy, but I think he has problems understanding the level of student awareness? Very passionate, but gets upset when students haven't reviewed supplemental material/ or don't speak up in class.

Dr. Guerra is a great professor. I took him for both Fluid Power and Instruments & Controls. His lectures are informative and he goes out of his way to provide extra resources to clear up questions you have. His homeworks and exams are straightforward and relevant to the class material, and he provides good feedback.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Guerra isn't a great lecturer. What he does excel in is his ability to prepare you for actual engineering work. His labs on PLC in instruments were thourough, and he was knowledgable in both execution and application. I also took his digital manufacturing class in tandem with senior design. Incredibly useful as a technical elective.

Great professor to get involved with due to his industry knowledge. Cares for the students future outlook and will provide useful information after the semester to further advance the students career. This professor will provide all the information about his course throughout the semester. Take notes as they will be helpful for homework problems.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Really knowledgeable professor about the program and the industry. Extremely well versed with PLC's. Very involved in getting students industry related projects or projects directly with the industry. A great connection to have. Gives plenty of supplemental material online. Take notes, pay attention, and ask questions and you will be just fine.

comment: He Does NOT Teach. He throws up power points, He points at them at his laser points, and just flips through slides without explaining anything. I asked questions and NEVER ONCE got an answer, just "you need to go study/should already know that from another class/ I'll talk about that later". No understanding comes from him.

Since he literally reads from the slides verbatim, nothing is gained from going to class. Sadly, participation is a huge component of your grade (10%). All of the questions on the tests were directly from homework assignments or book examples. It was pretty easy to get a good grade in the class, but he was probably the worst teacher I've ever had.
